title: How to move a bookshelf between houses - Quora

response.answer_text: Remove all the books.  If the shelves are removable, remove those too.  Using two people to lift, one at each end, pick it up and carefully move it to where you want it to be (use a moving van or truck).  Put it down.  Replace the shelves (if removed previously) and the books. Small bookshelves can be moved by a single person.  Large ones, and those constructed out of heavy materials, may require a dolly.

First take the books off. Then the shelves. Then pick it up and move it.  EDIT (since details added). Several people need to be involved in this, at least three. Guide the bookcase onto a large dolly, the kind used to move refrigerators. Strap it in place. Guide or lift onto a truck and drive it to the place you want it to go. Reverse steps.

If it is IKEA or some other brand of assembled furniture, can it be disassembled? If not, call a friend who owns a minivan, large SUV, or pickup truck. Additionally, it could possibly be hauled on a roof rack. If all that is undoable or too inconvenient, find a new one. But you are going to have to transport that one somehow as well.
